examples: He was amazed that she would have the gall to show herself.
I'm amazed that he lets them lead him around by the nose like that.
He was amazed by the high price tag on the caviar, realizing it was a luxury out of his reach.
Johnny's friends were amazed at how much he could eat when they went out to eat.
I asked, amazed.
words.defineEn: feeling or displaying great surprise
words.defineVi: cảm thấy hoặc hiển thị sự ngạc nhiên lớn

examples: Her comment about my work piqued my anger.
His apology took the edge off her anger.
He gritted his teeth in anger.
She was beside herself with anger.
The driver knew that anger and haste hinder good counsel when he was cut off in traffic.
words.defineEn: to make a person feel angry
words.defineVi: để làm cho một người cảm thấy tức giận

examples: You're so anxious to keep your children out of harm's way that you're going to end up denying them a lot of valuable life experiences.
I used to get really anxious about the future, but then I started reminding myself that every day brings its bread.
I think we all have been sitting on pins and needles and anxious for something to happen.
Sarah was always striving for more success and recognition at work, but she found herself constantly stressed and anxious.
Sarah tends to dwell on her mistakes, which makes her feel anxious and insecure.
words.defineEn: feeling nervous or worried because of thinking something unpleasant might happen
words.defineVi: cảm thấy lo lắng hoặc lo lắng vì nghĩ rằng điều gì đó khó chịu có thể xảy ra

examples: My anxiety usually keeps me from taking time by the forelock.
Leave it to anxiety to put a situation out of perspective.
Jane's parents were worried about her anxiety, but they knew that care is no cure and encouraged her to seek professional help.
John was a silent sufferer, never letting on to his colleagues that he was struggling with anxiety and depression.
He took to practicing yoga every morning to help him manage his stress and anxiety.
words.defineEn: a feeling of nervousness or worry that one might have about an uncertain outcome in the future
words.defineVi: một cảm giác hồi hộp hoặc lo lắng mà một người có thể có về một kết quả không chắc chắn trong tương lai

examples: The proposal has won the approval of the city council.
The bill has the President's seal of approval.
Fans have given the band's new song their seal of approval.
The politician is riding on the wave of public support, with high approval ratings and successful campaigns.
It's important to have confidence in your own abilities and worth, and not rely on the approval of others, as a nod from a lord is a breakfast for a fool.
words.defineEn: a positive feeling about someone or something
words.defineVi: một cảm giác tích cực về một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: Peter ought to be ashamed of himself.
Narcissists aren’t really that ashamed.
I was ashamed.
- I am ashamed of myself.
Peter felt ashamed.
words.defineEn: feeling embarrassed or sorry about a characteristic or about having done something wrong
words.defineVi: cảm thấy xấu hổ hoặc xin lỗi về một đặc điểm hoặc về việc đã làm sai điều gì đó

examples: Or die of boredom.
The opposite of that is boredom, where you have low challenges with the mid-range skills.
Is it just pure boredom?
Boredom with your routine task can also sink your spirit and your motivation.
And stress and boredom and loneliness affects the mind.
words.defineEn: the quality of being boring; the state of being bored
words.defineVi: chất lượng nhàm chán; tình trạng buồn chán

examples: She’s always so cheerful.
He has designed a collection of cheap and cheerful sportswear.
It’s not the best place you’ll ever eat at, but it’s cheap and cheerful.
There's a restaurant round the corner that serves cheap and cheerful food.

When reaching out to a friend who is going through a difficult time, it's important to be mindful of their emotional state and avoid being overly cheerful or upbeat, as the saying goes, bring not a bagpipe to a man in trouble.
words.defineEn: feeling happy and positive or behaving in a way that shows this
words.defineVi: cảm thấy hạnh phúc và tích cực hoặc cư xử theo cách thể hiện điều này

examples: I'm feeling a little depressed at the moment, but I'm sure good times are just around the corner.
A person with schizophrenia isn't necessarily depressed.
I am depressed.
I was depressed.
I was depressed.
words.defineEn: feeling very unhappy and having no hope
words.defineVi: cảm thấy rất buồn và không có hy vọng

examples: The GPS will guide you to your desired destination with turn-by-turn directions.
Apparently, Meg's cooking leaves a lot to be desired.
The accuracy of the information might leave something to be desired.
The slow elevator took a long time to reach the desired floor.
He learned the hard way to be more cautious with his desires.
words.defineEn: a very strong feeling of wanting to do or have something
words.defineVi: một cảm giác rất mạnh mẽ muốn làm hoặc có một cái gì đó

examples: Tabloids are always eager to get the dirt on famous celebrities.
He's eager to create a good impression at work.
He's eager to see the two candidates duke it out in the debate.
He was so eager to make money that he priced himself out of the market.
When it comes to civil rights issues, Mary is always eager to take up the gauntlet.
words.defineEn: having a strong desire for doing something or for something that is going to happen
words.defineVi: có một mong muốn mạnh mẽ để làm một cái gì đó hoặc cho một cái gì đó sẽ xảy ra

examples: Alan looks embarrassed.
She felt embarrassed when her coworkers laughed at her proposal during the meeting.
He was embarrassed by his moobs while taking off his shirt at the beach.
I wanted to shout at the man for jumping the line, but I was too embarrassed about making a scene.
I was so embarrassed when Danny started throwing a fit in the grocery store.
words.defineEn: feeling ashamed and uncomfortable because of something that happened or was said. especially in front of other people
words.defineVi: cảm thấy xấu hổ và không thoải mái vì điều gì đó đã xảy ra hoặc đã được nói ra. đặc biệt là trước mặt người khác

examples: The drug produces a feeling of excitement.
The child jumped up and down with excitement.
The crowd erupted into cries of excitement when their favorite band took the stage.
He learned to check his excitement.
Excitement was coursing through her blood ever more fiercely as she got closer to seeing her sister.
words.defineEn: a feeling of much enthusiasm and happiness
words.defineVi: một cảm giác rất nhiệt tình và hạnh phúc

examples: As frightened as I am to die, I'm also curious to know what it's like beyond the veil.
The villagers are very frightened of his ghost.
Mr Edgar looked very frightened.
I was kind of frightened.
I was definitely frightened.
words.defineEn: feeling afraid or anxious
words.defineVi: cảm thấy sợ hãi hoặc lo lắng

examples: I'm glad we can put this behind us.
We're glad to have you as part of our team.
I'm glad you read the riot act to Billy.
I felt glad to be back in harness.
I'm glad she's finally using her loaf.
words.defineEn: feeling happy or pleased
words.defineVi: cảm thấy hạnh phúc hoặc hài lòng

examples: I would be grateful if you could call me back at your earliest convenience.
We should be grateful for the opportunities and blessings in our lives, and not focus on what we lack.
Although Sarah wasn't able to attend the event, her friends were grateful for her sincere apologies, and decided to take the will for the deed.

The heartbroken man consoled himself with the thought that it is better to have loved and lost than never to have loved at all - he was grateful for the memories and experiences he had shared with his former partner.
Mark wasn't happy with his first draft of the book, but he's grateful for the chance to take a second bite at the cherry and revise it before submitting it to publishers.
words.defineEn: displaying or expressing thanks because someone has done something for one
words.defineVi: hiển thị hoặc bày tỏ sự cảm ơn vì ai đó đã làm điều gì đó cho một người

examples: That guy really hates my guts.
I hate shopping.
Everybody hates the sight of you.
I hate summer vacation.
Before all this, I just hated the sight of him.
words.defineEn: strong dislike for someone or something
words.defineVi: không thích mạnh mẽ cho một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: I was feeling guilty.
Judging by the evidence presented in court, the defendant is clearly guilty.
He looks guilty as sin, yes, but he insists he's innocent.
I hope this guilty verdict puts that rat of a CEO in his place.
Many judges admitted that the Dodge was their guilty pleasure out of our field.
words.defineEn: feeling bad because of having done something wrong or not having done something that should have been done
words.defineVi: cảm thấy tồi tệ vì đã làm sai điều gì đó hoặc đã không làm điều gì đó đáng lẽ phải làm

examples: The bank raised interest rates.
Everyone has different interests.
My parents always took an interest in my hobbies.
The movie trailer piqued my interest in the film.
These discussions held little interest for Lucy.
words.defineEn: the desire to find out or learn more about a person or thing
words.defineVi: mong muốn tìm hiểu hoặc tìm hiểu thêm về một người hoặc vật

examples: John had always been interested in technology and gadgets.
Don’t rely on him for help, he’s only interested in saving his own skin.
Government is much more interested in announcements than it is in actually doing the work to set the economy back on its feet.
The Romans were not interested in persecuting people and putting them to the sword.
Our research showed us that women were more interested in their health than men.
words.defineEn: giving much attention to something or someone because one likes them
words.defineVi: chú ý nhiều đến một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó bởi vì một người thích họ

examples: But her charm had inspired lethal jealousy.
And the social networks fill with jealousy.
- Anyways, maybe a little jealousy is a good thing.
'A little jealousy will stop him feeling so sorry for himself!'
Their jealousy drove them to a frenzy and they destroyed poor Orpheus.
words.defineEn: the state of being angry or unhappy because someone else has what one desires
words.defineVi: trạng thái tức giận hoặc không vui vì người khác có thứ mình mong muốn

examples: Can two lonely men truly reach out?
He strikes an attitude of bravery and lonely defiance.
I was a little bit lonely at the time and she took me under her wing.
He had been single for a while and was feeling lonely, but reminded himself that for everything, there is a season, and he believed he would find love when the time was right.
She was lonely when she first left home, but she is finding her feet now.
words.defineEn: feeling sad because of having no friends to talk to or spend time with
words.defineVi: cảm thấy buồn vì không có bạn bè để nói chuyện hoặc dành thời gian cho

examples: That noise is driving me mad!
My dad was mad as a hornet after I crashed his car.
John has been mad at Mary for a week.
To go crazy/mad/nuts/insane.
The family's hopping mad that she left them nothing.
words.defineEn: very angry or displeased
words.defineVi: rất tức giận hoặc không hài lòng

examples: Her work has given pleasure to millions of readers.
She takes pleasure in her work.
The books in the library are available for checkout at their pleasure.
The murderer was imprisoned at His Majesty's pleasure.
I'm just going to find pleasure in perfect little moments like this.
words.defineEn: a feeling of great enjoyment and happiness
words.defineVi: một cảm giác vô cùng thích thú và hạnh phúc

examples: I used slices of bully beef as a topping for my homemade pizza.
The bullies always laugh at him when he makes a mistake in class.
Bullies usually can dish it out, but they can't take it.
He opened a can of bully beef to make a quick sandwich for his lunch.
Management often turn a blind eye to bullying in the workplace.
words.defineEn: to scare or hurt other people or make them do something against their will
words.defineVi: sợ hãi hoặc làm tổn thương người khác hoặc khiến họ làm điều gì đó trái với ý muốn của họ

examples: I'm very saddened by this process.
It saddens me that people even have to realize that hey, this person might be a deaf person.
And so that saddens me, saddens me for the people that work there as a businessperson.
A statement from Buckingham Palace today said that Queen Elizabeth and the royal family are saddened by the claims.
And so that saddens me, saddens me for the people that work there as a businessperson.
words.defineEn: to feel sorrow
words.defineVi: cảm thấy buồn

examples: The finance minister's fall from grace gave his enemies great satisfaction.
The CEO's focus on customer satisfaction was reflected in the employees' behavior, as like master, like man.
Curiosity killed the cat, but satisfaction brought it back.
George looked back on his career in government with a great deal of satisfaction.
The business owner prioritized ethical practices and customer satisfaction over profit, believing that a good name is better than riches.
words.defineEn: a feeling of pleasure that one experiences after doing or achieving what one really desired
words.defineVi: một cảm giác thích thú mà một người trải nghiệm sau khi làm hoặc đạt được những gì một người thực sự mong muốn

examples: His shout scared me witless.
You scared the daylights out of me, yelling like that.
Don't sneak up on me like that, you scared the wits out of me!
The door used to blow open and scare me witless.
The coach punished the entire team for the actions of a few players, using the tactic of kill the chicken to scare the monkey to ensure that everyone followed the rules.
words.defineEn: to suddenly make a person or animal feel much fear
words.defineVi: để đột nhiên làm cho một người hoặc động vật cảm thấy nhiều sợ hãi

examples: The sandwich shop offered satisfying gammon and cheese paninis.
A slice of acerola pie is the perfect dessert to satisfy my sweet tooth.
The farmer harvested a basket of potatoes from the field, satisfied with a successful yield.
She satisfied her sweet craving with sliced strawberries drizzled in glossy ganache sauce.
She enjoyed a simple yet satisfying meal of roasted chicken and wild rice.
words.defineEn: to make someone happy by doing what they want or giving them what they desire
words.defineVi: để làm cho ai đó hạnh phúc bằng cách làm những gì họ muốn hoặc cho họ những gì họ mong muốn

examples: Spending time with her family always does Emily the world of good, especially when she's feeling stressed or overwhelmed.
Tim was feeling stressed and overwhelmed, which caused him to be off his food and lose interest in eating.
When I'm feeling stressed or overwhelmed, I try to remember that patience is a plaster for all sores, and that taking a step back and giving myself time can help to alleviate my anxiety.
By the end of the study, the chocolate eaters are less stressed than their chocolate-free counterparts.
Like, these results could happen because, say, more stressed people turn to their phones for relief.
words.defineEn: feeling so anxious that makes one unable to relax
words.defineVi: cảm thấy lo lắng đến mức khiến người ta không thể thư giãn

examples: It's the calm after a storm.
His judgment is calmer, and he puts the saddle on the right horse.
The night brings a sense of calm and tranquility.
What the country was experiencing was not peace, but just the calm before another storm.
She drank a glass of warm water to calm her upset stomach.
words.defineEn: to become or make someone become relaxed and quiet
words.defineVi: để trở thành hoặc làm cho ai đó trở nên thoải mái và yên tĩnh

examples: The daredevil performer, Max, shocked the audience by performing his entire circus act in his birthday suit.
Jessica's parents were shocked when they discovered she swings both ways.
After the initial shock, Lisa got a grip on herself and called an ambulance.
I have to admit that the news gave us a shock.
The shock of the announcement make me go weak at the knees.
words.defineEn: to cause strong surprise or to upset
words.defineVi: để gây ra bất ngờ mạnh mẽ hoặc khó chịu

examples: Mary frightened me and took my breath away.
Do you think that is seeking to frighten the wits out of the citizenry?
A tremendous wind swept off the land and frightened the living daylights out of us.
It was a painful reminder that an empty purse frightens away friends.
It frightens people sometimes.
words.defineEn: to make a person feel fear
words.defineVi: để làm cho một người cảm thấy sợ hãi

examples: Hunger drives the wolf out of the wood.
Have an apple - it'll take the edge off your hunger.
But I grabbed something to stay the pangs of hunger on the way down.
After hiking all day and working up an appetite, the simple meal of beans and rice tasted amazing - truly, hunger is the best sauce.
My heart bleeds for any child suffering from hunger.
words.defineEn: the feeling that a person gets when they need to eat
words.defineVi: cảm giác mà một người có được khi họ cần ăn

examples: - Have self-respect.
And so the gun has become a symbol of rural identity and rural self-respect.
And so the gun has become a symbol of rural identity and rural self-respect.
No self-respecting person Waste the water in this state let me just say that's the thing I do first before shampoo Speaking of pee in the shower.
But this White House, it may be good at some level to have worked in Donald Trump's White House for somebody, but it's terrible for one's self-respect.
words.defineEn: a feeling that shows a person values themselves and is confident about who they are
words.defineVi: một cảm giác cho thấy một người coi trọng bản thân và tự tin về con người của họ

examples: Startled by the sudden appearance of a ghost, he let out a cry of horror.
The left didn't know what the right was doing in this gross teen horror comedy.
It is a bizarre tale and the author hits just the right note of horror and disbelief.
The very thought of the horror those people caused makes a chill run down my spine.
He stared at me in horror, his mouth working.
words.defineEn: a great fear or shock
words.defineVi: một nỗi sợ hãi lớn hoặc sốc

examples: The exhausted runner flopped onto the ground after crossing the finish line.
That's why we're all exhausted today.
I'm sorry, Mimi, I'm just too exhausted to go out tonight.
He's fresh out of a long road trip and feeling exhausted from the journey.

Despite feeling discouraged and exhausted after months of job searching, Mary remained committed to her career goals by remembering that it is dogged that does it, and ultimately landed her dream job.
words.defineEn: completely drained of energy, often due to physical or mental exertion
words.defineVi: hoàn toàn cạn kiệt năng lượng, thường là do gắng sức về thể chất hoặc tinh thần
